note.p: Education: Mr Richard Hest and Quartus Hest's School at Swaffham, Norfolk; Caius College, Cambridge; BA (1751), MA (1763), DD (Oxford 1771)

Career: Ordained deacon (1754) and priest (1756); Vicar of Little Barwick, Norfolk (1760-1764); Chaplain at St Petersburg (1764); Rector of Wormley, Hertfordshire (1`783-1787); Preacher at Spring Garden Chapel, London
Notes: DNB says born in Norfolk, Venn says Stowmarket
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 1. 1731-1847' in NR 2002 vol 56 pp 307-332
J H Appleby, 'The founding of St Petersburg in the context of the Royal Society's relationship with Russia' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 273-284
